body.p: Military organization (U.S.A.) that oversaw military activities, financial transactions, quartermaster reports, aid societies, and the care of sick and wounded soldiers for the state of Ohio. Agents located in Columbus, Cincinnati, Cleveland, Crestline, and Gallipolis. Main office located in Washington D.C. Principal agent was James C. Wetmore between 1861 and 1865.
